intro: Allium akaka, commonly known as the Hawaiian leek, is a perennial plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Allium genus, which includes onions, garlic, and chives. The plant features basal leaves that are broad and bluish-green in color, with a distinct garlic-like aroma. It produces clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Allium akaka is often found growing in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially shaded environments.
